@jackylk
please rebase correctly
@jackylk : I've rebased please have a look
I think there are still repeated commits, can you create a new branch based on latest master code and squash your commit?
Please modify the description of this PR, you should describe what test case are added. And it is better to separate them into different PR each one below 500 lines, because this PR is too big

@jackylk Removed ValueCompressionUtilTest from this PR.
CarbonUtil had a lot of test cases so i cannot make it below 500 lines.

I suggestion the trim should not be the properties of the table. 
because in actually scenario the table designer is in front, then data of the this table is generated. 
so the designer may don not consider which column need trim that may only can know after data generated. 
So I suggestion this trim operation should be consider when data load. 
during the data load user can set all column trim or not and also set trim for special column both for datalod command and insert command

CI passed.
http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/545/

CI passed: http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/548/
@chenliang613 pls help to review, thanks.

@Bill, i think while creating table the user shall know the entire schema which he is trying to generate and what kind of data/datatype is required for his table based on the expected data, if we provide the support in data load there are few drawbacks which we discussed in the prior discussion thread, please check.

i will repeat the cons again if we set this property while data loading.
cons of this approach will be suppose in one load user loaded with dirty data and suddenly he realizes no i need to trim then in the next load he will enable the option and load the data, this will increase the dictionary space also, also in query dictionary lookup overhead will increase.
just a thinking you can add your points  :)
@QiangCai fixed
LGTM

@jackylk I've create the new PR with new branch, Please have a look
https://github.com/apache/incubator-carbondata/pull/279

@Hexiaoqiao Thanks for you started the PR.

Please update the comment also , remove "@param columnIdentifier".
/**
- @param columnIdentifier
- @param storeLocation
- @param tableIdentifier
- @return store path related to tables
  */
@chenliang613  @ravipesala  Thanks for ur comments, i have fixed it, pls help to review, thanks.
LGTM

@sujith  I got your point. 
but I think trim data should belong to the step when process the data, which not belong to the table properties. 
the scenario what's your des is exist even if specify it when create table. 
For example when create the table they donot think it need trim the column1, but when actually data come or some business changed it need trim it. how to process this scenario? recreate the table or alter the table properties?   :)

@kumarvishal09 ....This change is for dictionary decoder that will convert the final result from surrogate to actual values. Compaction will not hit this flow. In compaction clearing dictionary is already handled where we create the query model and clean the dictionary cache after query result processing is complete.

Seems CarbonExample.scala is failing without any modification, error in CarbonDataRDDFactory:1067 
And if I add `OPTIONS ('USE_KETTLE' = 'false')` in load statement, the same error occured

@jackylk Fixed the error, please review.
http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/578/
please add testcases for new flow
ci passed: http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/579/

@chenliang613  thanks for ur comment, i have fixed it. 
Actually there are still some parameters' name include 'hdfs*' such as #CarbonGlobalDictionaryRDD.scala, i think it makes sense using 'hdfs' since it involves with some configurations which specify explicitly hdfs path,  [HDFS_TEMP_LOCATION = "hadoop.tmp.dir"] in CarbonCommonConstants.java for one.

@jackylk Fixed review comments, please review..
All existing ~600 test cases can run on new data load flow. Please configure `use_kettle_default = false` in CarbonHiveContext.scala. By default this configuration sets to true to run using kettle flow.

ok, verified. But we should not modify the code for only testing the new flow. Can you modify pom.xml to add a profile or property  to make it testable in mvn?
And please add "using new flow" in CarbonDataRDDFactory:761 in the audit log to indicate using new flow in the log, so that we can check the test log to verify it is using new flow

Meanwhile, I will do one more around of code review.
LGTM
LGTM

@sujith71955 @bill1208 
actually, in my opinion, trimming data should belong to data preprocessing.  If we must put trim property in carbon, I think it is better to put trim option in loading data part. If user put unprepocessing data into table, it is user's fault.

@nareshpr Actually there is already one check exists in CarbonStrategies 

```
if (CarbonEnv.getInstance(sqlContext).carbonCatalog
            .isTablePathExists(toTableIdentifier(tableName.toLowerCase))(sqlContext))
```

why this check is not working? And why we need to add extra check in this PR?
